title: Please add option to keep leading zeroes in paths
body:
`svgomg` is useful for android vector drawables too. However, when using svgo-compressed paths, you get this warning in Android Studio:

> Use 0.3 instead of .3 to avoid crashes on some devices

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/958469/87350752-98d34d00-c558-11ea-82d2-038f82241a44.png)

Please add an option to keep leading zeroes, so you we can utilize `svgomg` for android vector drawables! Disabling the _"Round/rewrite paths"_ feature is not desirable.

title: How to save for complete offline use?
body:
Hi, I love this but If i clear my cookies, i no longer am able to use it offline.
Is there a way to save the app / use it completely offline **using browser**?

title: Shrink viewbox to svg image size
Feature Request: Provide option for onlyMatchedOnce in inlineStyles plugin
body:
There seems to be a strange default behaviour in the `inlineStyles` plugin where styles are not always inlined if a class is used multiple times. Could the `onlyMatchedOnce` option be set to `false`, or an option be provided on the GUI for this?

https://github.com/svg/svgo/issues/1259

title: SVGOMG improvements
body:
https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/
Remove ID doesn't seem to work
Would it be possible to convert inline style and ID to path fill

title: For Web Interface: import from URL
body: This would make it easier on a mobile browser that doesn't offer easy visibility to xml. Just paste in an svg url and go from there.

title: Will be good, if precision can work automatically (based at viewport sizes)
body:
Will be good, if precision can work automatically (based at viewport sizes)

Desiners often draw at very big sizes, but viewport - 20-30px with =)

title: [Feature Request] Copy settings as CLI string
body:
I love previewing SVGO settings in SVGOMG, thanks!

It would be fantastic to have a button at near the config settings "Copy settings as CLI", like:

`npx svgo test.svg --precision=n  --config="<ESCAPED_JSON_STRING>"`

title: Optimizing SVG map
body:
example file to optimize:
`view-source:http://xn--dahlstrm-t4a.net/tmp/sharp-icons/svg-icon-target.svg`

usage:
http://jsfiddle.net/simurai/7GCGr/

What do you think about this feature?

title: Replace kebab-case with camelCase
body:
Recently, I was using svgomg to preprocess svgs for react components and found myself manually changing "fill-rule" to "fillRule" for each component.

As a react developer,
I can export svgs with camelCase property names,
so that I can use the results as react components.

title: Add advice for auto-precision without an image degradation
Request: Allow to optimize embedded raster images
body:
Hi! First I want to thank everyone involved in this project, it helped me a lot in the past few years.

In some of the projects that I am currently working on, we are receiving a lot of SVGs with embedded raster images. Some of this embedded images are making the SVGs bigger than what they should be. I was thinking if it makes sense to implement a plugin in SVGO that tries to improve the embedded images. Also, I would be more than happy to start working in a PR for it with some guidance.

Thanks!

title: xmlns="https://...." not supported in the preview
body: As soon as i paste in svg with `xmlns="https://www.w3.org/2000/svg"` preview does not show the image.

title: Request: allow to import VectorDrawable files
body:
[Those files](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/drawable/VectorDrawable.html) are of Android, as SVG isn't supported on Android.
When an Android developers wishes to use SVG, it's converted to this format.
There is also a way to convert back to SVG. Example:
https://github.com/jaredrummler/vector2svg

Please allow to import VectorDrawable too.

title: Request: allow batch operation
body: As the title says

title: SVGOMG service is not working anymore
body:
Hi,

Looks like the **application is not working anymore**...
Even with the demo picture I get this error:

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2471223/72144947-bd781d80-3399-11ea-9cb2-f92ad5a431c3.JPG)

Thanks for your feedback! :wink:

title: Fix #124 - Timeout transitionend event
body:
Occasionally the image/markup tabs get stuck in Firefox and you can no longer switch between them. It seems that the `"transitionend"` event sometimes doesn't fire, and as a result the previous promise in the queue never resolves.

The quick fix is to add a timeout with `Promise.race`. Neither promise rejects, so it's sufficient here.

title: Make optimization settings overridable via the URL
body:
As a developer trying to evangelize SVG optimization best practices, I'd like to be able to share a link to SVGOMG with pre-configured optimization settings that follow our best practices.

Perhaps with URL query parameters, for example: https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/?removeDoctype=false?

title: [Feature Request] Current color
SVG not working in Adobe Illustrator
body: I have optimized some SVG icons that look fine when I open them in the browser but when I open them in Adobe Illustrator they don't display on the artboard.

title: SVG codes should be indented with U+0009
body: Character tabulation (U+0009) is usually used to indent the source codes, but SVGOMG doesn’t make use of that while _Prettify markup_ is selected. This can be reproduced if you open the website, click Demo, and select Prettify markup.

title: Update rollup-plugin-babel-minify
body:
I also refreshed dependencies in package-lock.json (addresses 165 out of 167 vulnerabilities reported by `npm audit`) 
>found 167 vulnerabilities (10 low, 4 moderate, 153 high)

Fixes #169

title: Unable to build: Rollup Error / 'babel-minify' / Invalid typeof value
body:
Thanks for this awesome project!

I tried to build this locally after running `npm install` and ran into this error:
```
Rollup Error Error: Error transforming bundle with 'babel-minify' plugin: unknown: Invalid typeof value
    at error (/Users/adam/git/svgomg/node_modules/rollup/dist/rollup.js:185:14)
    at /Users/adam/git/svgomg/node_modules/rollup/dist/rollup.js:9216:5 {
  code: 'BAD_BUNDLE_TRANSFORMER',
  plugin: 'babel-minify'
}
```

I'm running node v12.11.1 and npm 6.12.0. Bumping `rollup-plugin-babel-minify` to the next major version appears to fix the issue, but I can't think why this new issue would emerge, given that the dependency hasn't changed in two years 🤔 https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/blame/master/package.json#L20

title: Remove id attribute
body:
Add option to remove id attribute.

Eg.:

    <path id="canvas_background" d="M-1-1h582v402H-1z"/>

To:

    <path d="M-1-1h582v402H-1z"/>

title: Files now break / corrupt when uploading to GT Sport.
body:
Hi, I use SVGOMG almost daily to shrink SVGs and upload them to the game Gran Turismo Sport via their website.  GT Sport has a 15kb limit per file, so SVGOMG is absolutely vital in the process of getting complex images onto the game.

Since the latest update to SVGOMG I (and a friend also) have found the SVGs now break (distortion / stretching / glitchy looking) when uploading to the game.  I have uploaded un-OMG'd files below 15kb and ones shrunk by SVGminify.com (v.limited in comparison to your tool) and they work fine.

Here is an image to illustrate what happens when the files get onto the game.  The 1st 4 files pictured were put through SVGOMG.  The 5th was below 15kb so didn't go through SVGOMG.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56097686/66090603-186cce00-e57c-11e9-9175-3d32ea29ac61.png)

Each time I back out of where the SVG's are found in-game I find their appearance has glitched in a different way to the last.

Please do what you can to investigate this issue.  SVGOMG is very important to the GT Sport community.  

Also, is there a way to access the previous version in the meantime?  Apologies if this is a silly question, I am not used to GitHub.  Thank you.

title: Is this project abandoned?
body: There are a lot of issues and PR to be solved. Are you looking for new maintainers? I could give you some help.

title: Simplify code contributions, reviews and automate dev setup with a single click
body:
Hi! :slightly_smiling_face: 

this PR simplifies code contributions by fully automating the dev setup with Gitpod (a free online VS Code-like IDE ). With a single click, it'll launch a workspace and automatically:

- clone the svgomg repo.
- install the dependencies.
- run  `npm start`.

So that anyone interested in contributing can start straight away.

You can give it a try on my fork of the repo via the following link:

https://gitpod.io/#https://github.com/nisarhassan12/svgomg

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46004116/60317237-8f943400-9987-11e9-9e88-c18d6d721f98.png)

title: Add option to remove classes
body: Add option to remove css classes on the markup.

title: Remove data attributes
body:
If you export a SVG file from something like Illustrator, it might have some info about layers. This is also saved as ` data-name="Layer 6"` in the `svg` element. This is of course completely useless information only taking up space.

It would be great if there were an feature option to strip all `data-` attributes.

Btw thanks for the great tool!

title: Script injected when downloading SVG
Gulp version syntax in package.json causes installation issues
body:
In`package.json`, the line `"gulp": "github:gulpjs/gulp#4.0"` results in installation errors:

```
npm ERR! Command failed: git checkout 4.0
npm ERR! error: pathspec '4.0' did not match any file(s) known to git.
```
This seems related to https://github.com/gulpjs/gulp/issues/2078 and other issues referenced there.

Changing that line to `"gulp": "^4.0.0"` solves the issue.

Thank you very much for the tool!

title: Electron App
body: Is is possible you can also release a electron app?

title: Enable pasting SVG without clicking the "Paste markup" button
body:
In Figma, if you have SVG code in your clipboard and just hit Ctrl+V (or Cmd+V on macOS) in a document, it creates a new frame with your SVG in that document. It's a really nice way to work with SVG quickly.

It would be great to have the same in SVGOMG. It probably needs no UI. Only need to listen for the right keyboard shortcut on the page. Though I guess there might be security restrictions that Figma works around with an invisible input, I’m not sure.

body:
As recommended by the Google HTML Styleguide:

https://google.github.io/styleguide/htmlcssguide.html#Encoding

title: Update "prefer viewBox to width/height" to either viewBox OR width/height
body:
**Problem:**
SVGs sometimes apeare blurred in Google Image Search.
This happens, when a SVG-Image hasn't got a width / height attribut.

Exampel:
blurred in Google Image Search:
`<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" id="Layer_1" viewBox="0 0 1198 1194">`

Clear in Google Image Search
`<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" id="Layer_1" viewBox="0 0 1199 1194" width="1199" height="1194">`

**Idea:**
You could either add width / height attribut in the sourounding HTML; or you define the size of the SVG direct in the SVG Image.


**Possible Solution**
Therefore, it would be good, when SVGOMG has an Option to include these width and heigh attributes & values directly to the SVG-Code.
Here, it might be a good idea to combine this with the already existing Option "prefer viewBox to width/height"


**Whats next?**
I'm not familiar with the source code of this Project and responsibilitys:
- What do you think, would this feature be interesting?
- Could someone add this Feature?
- If not: could someone tell me there to find the function that needs to be changed?

title: Select only svg code without results text
body: When you whant copy svg code and try select all text by mouse or shortcut we have copied results statistic text.

title: Issue when pasting from Illustrator
body:
When copying and pasting from Illustrator into SVGOMG I get this error:

> Load failed: Error in parsing SVG: Text data outside of root node. Line: 13 Column: 1 Char:

The weird thing is, if I paste the markup into a text editor, and then copy and paste exactly the same thing, it works fine.

Here's the markup for that error:

```html
<!-- Generator: Adobe Illustrator 22.1.0, SVG Export Plug-In  -->
<svg version="1.1"
	 xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:a="http://ns.adobe.com/AdobeSVGViewerExtensions/3.0/"
	 x="0px" y="0px" width="65px" height="65px" viewBox="0 0 65 65" style="enable-background:new 0 0 65 65;" xml:space="preserve">
<style type="text/css">
	.st0{fill:#FFFFFF;}
	.st1{fill:none;}
</style>
<defs>
</defs>
<path class="st0" d="M38,9.5H13.8v46h37.4V22.7L38,9.5z M45.4,49.8H19.6V15.2h16.1l1.2,1.2v7.4h7.4l1.2,1.2V49.8z"/>
<rect class="st1" width="65" height="65"/>
</svg>
```

Using [this tool](https://www.soscisurvey.de/tools/view-chars.php) there appears to be a `00` character in there messing things up:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/226483/47624044-df171d00-dae5-11e8-972b-7ab2c08dbc38.png)

Would you accept a PR to trim hidden characters when pasting?

title: Bad file extension
body:
I accidentally found this little issue: when using a file named `test.sgv` (write by mistake) as input, **the GUI keeps the original file extension** and output `.sgv`. Keeping the filename is a good idea, but the extension must end with `.svg`.

I know that users have to pay attention to filenames, but a file that is output by a data conversion process should fit the data format target, and so respect the SVG file extension.

Nice and useful web application btw :wink:

title: White SVGs are hard to see against background
body:
When compressing small, white icons at work, I find myself consistently jumping into DevTools and changing the page's background to a darker color, so I can see the icon's edges.

#f2f2f2 (current background-color)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9473554/44870690-bb4e6c80-ac45-11e8-8ab1-3d7bab3385e6.png)

#333
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9473554/44870709-c7d2c500-ac45-11e8-9b42-4579eb337325.png)

We could detect SVG colors on the fly and switch to dark mode if they're lighter on average than a certain threshold. 

Alternatively, a little UI toggle between light & dark mode would do the job (though there's already so many toggles I'd hate to add to them).

I'd be happy to submit a PR if either of these options look promising. Thanks again for such a handy tool!

title: Button to reset configuration
body:
Adds a new button to the main menu that can be used to reset the configuration of SVGO. As requested in #101 (and [simple-icons/#771](https://github.com/simple-icons/simple-icons/issues/771)).

### Design considerations
- ~~There is currently no "Are you sure" popup when clicking the reset configuration button, might be an idea to add it~~ (added with dfb7392)
- The button is currently in the mainMenuUI, could also be placed in the settingsUI. I'm fine either way 😄 

### Clarification of the code
- [main-controller.js:277](https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/pull/141/files#diff-a4743a35a5a5dd4f27da459b1fa5ebeaR277) was added because the reset button calls `_compressSvg`, but may be called when no SVG has been selected yet.
- I'm emitting an event in [main-menu.js:97](https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/pull/141/files#diff-8a2874b84bbf96aff0c3afad995acddeR97) mainly because I couldn't think of a better approach

### Tested on Desktop
- [x] Chrome
- [x] Firefox
- [ ] Safari
- [ ] IE/Edge

### Tested on Mobile
- [ ] Chrome
- [ ] Firefox

title: Feature Request: Order elements to Group Paths
body:
The elements could be reorderd to save path elements

**Sample SVG**
```
<svg>
    <path d="M0,0 h25 v25 h-25 z"/>
    <use href="#a"/>
    <path d="M100,100 h25 v25 h-25 z"/>
<svg/>
```


**Output**
```
<svg>
    <use href="#a"/>
    <path d="M0,0 h25 v25 h-25 z M100,100 h25 v25 h-25 z"/>
<svg/>
```

title: SVGOMG does not remember my settings
body:
A few weeks or months ago, SVGOMG remembered the settings from one session to the next. That is not the case anymore. For example, if I uncheck "Remove viewBox" and I check "Prefer viewBox to width/height", I get the correct result during the current session. If I close the browser, restart it and go to SVGOMG and open an SVG file, the settings are back to their default values.

Tested in Chrome and Firefox on Windows 7.

- assetlinks file contains debug and prod keys.

title: Option to Remove Self-closing Tags
body:
An option to remove self-closing tags would be a nice enhancement to support legacy HTML 4/5 requirements. 

Example Before: `<path d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/>`
Example After: `<path d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"></path>`

Currently, I'm using this regex `<\s*([^\s>]+)([^>]*)/\s*>` to match self-closing tags and replacing matching groups with `<$1$2></$1>`.

btw, SVGOMG is a game changer. Great work!

Add new plugins

title: Generate CSS background code (feature request)
body:
It'd be nice to have something like this as a separate tab on the tool (next to "CODE"):

https://bjorn-ali-goransson.github.io/convert-svg-to-css-background.html

On the left hand column, you can paste SVG markup. On the right hand column, you will get a complete `background-image:` CSS snippet, encoding only the minimally required characters to work in IE etc. (that information is from https://css-tricks.com/probably-dont-base64-svg/ )

Also, you can paste such CSS snippets into the right hand column to get your SVG markup back!

title: Heads-up: transformsWithOnePath plugin was recently removed
body:
In a recent version of svgo it looks like the `transformsWithOnePath` plugin has been removed. Thought I would give you a heads up since the svgo changelog doesn't mention this (I've asked the maintainer if he can update the changelog with details though).

Link to the svgo commit: https://github.com/svg/svgo/commit/055e303607d53a3d539761d8727d86c03b2e88c1#diff-63dc9087c660611bdf3fcb1a1257247a

title: Delete unused load-scripts.js file
body: I think this file is no longer necessary now that you've migrated to using ES6 modules?

title: Fix possible typo in utils.js
body: Unless you are referencing a global variable I'm not aware of... I think you meant to use `str` instead of `string`?

title: Any plans to enable React-ification of SVG?
body: Would be a nice feature if it could convert `stop-color `to `stopColor `and similar React needed transforms. Covert styles into objects, etc.

title: Don't round / rewrite transforms
body:
I opened this with default settings and graphics are ruined: https://dev.w3.org/SVG/tools/svgweb/samples/svg-files/gallardo.svg

Rounding transforms is a crazy idea. E.g. when a matrix has all values smaller than 0.001, rounding it to 3 - 4 places will ruin the whole transform.

This option should be either smarter (e.g. take the determinant into account), or removed completely.

2. Delete or move test.svg
3. Put a different file named test.svg into /home/Downloads
4. Upload new test.svg file

The file won't be loaded into the app. I assume that is a problem with the app, but could of course also be

title: Bulk edit: multi-file upload, compress, and download
body: Fixes https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/issues/64 - [x] Open SVG multiple. - [x] Drop multiple. - [x] Demo multiple. - [x] List of files in the menu, select one for details. - [x] View image of the selected file. - [x] View code of the selected file. - [x] Copy the text of the selected file. - [x] Download the selected file. - [x] Download all the files in a ZIP archive (thanks to jszip). ------

body: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/iteration

title: Results better here than via svgo in Node.js - doing anything different?
body:
The results I get via your web app are fantastic. When I try running the same SVGs through svgo via Node.js, they are not as good. I've tried using the exact same settings - but are you doing something else to help your process come out better? 

If anybody has this exact app in a form that can accept folders or batch  - I'd love to know about it! Thanks for the lovely tool.

title: Add switch for option 'utilizeAbsolute' in convertPathData function
body:
There is an option `utilizeAbsolute` in the `convertPathData` function to disable the mixing of relative and absolute coordinates.
The mixing of absolute and relative coordinates can break animations!! 
It would be nice to have a switch for this.

title: Add the 'useShortTags' option
body:
In SVGO version >0.5.4 there is a paramter called `useShortTags` which is `true` by default. 
To make a svg compatible to old browsers it would be nice to have a option for this in the gui.

title: Set minimum of precision to 0
body:
Change 
`<input type="range" min="1" max="8" step="1" value="3" name="floatPrecision" class="">`
to
`<input type="range" min="0" max="8" step="1" value="3" name="floatPrecision" class="">`
because sometimes whole number needs

title: Option to create unique ID's
body: When inlining multiple svg's on a web page there will be masking problems because of duplicate ID's. An option to create unique ID's would be very helpful. An unique ID could be a string of 10 characters or so.

title: How to run it as pure HTML+JavaScript without any backend server?
body: Is it possible to package HTML and JavaScript files to run it locally without the involvement of client-server communication?

title: How about multiple SVGs and each can pan and zoom to create infograph?
add vector effects support, for no stroke scaling
body:
This is very needed to use inline svg icons on website.
vector-effect="non-scaling-stroke" to make all stroke the same when icons are scaled

reference: http://callmenick.com/post/svg-vector-effects

title: Add sprite creation possibility
body:
Hi, Jake! Would you be interested in PR to SVGOMG with svg sprite creation support? I wanted to create this as a pet project, but then I thought that I could improve yours, which was my inspiration.
PS. It's not ready yet, I've just started.

title: Add 'minifyStyles' svgo plugin
body: Looks like this plugin was added recently. It'd be awesome if it were added to SVGOMG!

body:
Hello! Thank you for your job.

I try to optimize my SVG through https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/

```xml
</svg>
```

But it throws an error:

```
Minifying error: Cannot read property 'value' of undefined
```

body:
The option "Round/rewrite Transform" cutes the picture with a high "resolution" to a smaller size
In the Attachment is the SVG before and after.
[CompareRoundRewiteTransforms.zip](https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/files/746019/CompareRoundRewiteTransforms.zip)

body:
The option "Round/rewrite path" removes some lines/curves, some lines/curves are completely different place.
In the Attachment is the SVG before and after.

[ChangeRoundRewritePath.zip](https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/files/746010/ChangeRoundRewritePath.zip)

title: Add remove style element plugin
body:
https://github.com/svg/svgo/blob/master/plugins/removeStyleElement.js

This plugin is disabled by default so should be a relatively inoffensive addition.

title: Inline styles may save space
body:
A document like this:

    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 64 64"><style>.st0{fill:#020203;}</style><path class="st0" ...

May use up unnecessary space if the style is only used once. An option to inline styles should maybe be supported.

title: Overlay of SVG pixel/unit grid
body: I've often wanted a way to see an SVG's pixel grid—or rather, the SVG's native unit grid, which could be separate from the size of pixels. Would this be something that could be added as an overlay?

title: Strip null terminator appended by Illustrator
body:
Copy/pasting directly from an Illustrator artboard yields a null-terminated string, causing SVGO to throw `Text data outside of root node.`

Stripping the null terminator from the paste input's value fixes the issue and closes #68.

title: Tooltips
body: Maybe some tooltips for the circle buttons would be useful as I still don't get what the "copy button" is for. Where copies it data to/from?

title: Option to show plain white background
body: Some people might not prefer the squared background and a white one might sometimes be more helpful, especially when you're trying to view small images (icons) without zooming in.

title: Show zoom indicator and add "original size" button
body:
When zooming in and out one might loose track what size is currently shown. Therefore all image editing tools somewhere show the current zoom as a percentage somewhere. This should also be done here.
Additionally I propose to add a button "original zoom" or "100% zoom" or so near this zoom indicator, so one can easily switch back to the original size when messing around with the zoom level.

title: Add other comparison methods
body:
It would be nice to have other comparison methods than just "Show the original". I very much like [GitHub's ones e.g.](https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/commit/77add432113ca17efdca2581298a570d659c1923#diff-0).

You might think about:
* [ ] 2-up (just show them side by side)
* [ ] Swipe (a bar fort comparing)
* [ ] Onion skin (work with transparency as it seems)

title: Show border of SVG
body: Sometimes you have SVGs with white space at some sides (e.g. to make them match a square area). In this case it is useful to see the border of the SVG, so if you could add an option for this it would be very much appreciated.

title: Warn before leaving site
body:
IMHO the site should warn before leaving the site (e.g. when choosing another file, clicking on "Demo" or opening a link) when the image/options have been modified, so one does not accidentally loose the current state.

That's just the behaviour of all other image editing tools.

title: `Load failed: Text data outside of root node.` when pasting from Illustrator
body:
A recent (ish? it's been a while) update causes `Load failed: Text data outside of root node` to be thrown when pasting directly from Illustrator (ie copying from an artboard). This error is _technically_ correct, since Illustrator prepends a comment when copy/pasting SVG: 

```<!-- Generator: Adobe Illustrator 20.1.0, SVG Export Plug-In  -->```

That said, it would be nice if instead of throwing an error and canceling the paste process you instead 

- a) Threw a warning that some text was stripped but continued with loading
- b) Threw an error but allowed the user to continue anyways (stripping the excess text)

title: https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/ site is not generating SVGs
body:
FYI: Since yesterday, I have been unable to use https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/ to generate SVG files.  The site will load, but nothing happens when you place a SVG file there.

Installing and running this app locally still works.

title: Pasting invalid markup doesn't indicate any error
body:
Clarifying #65:
- Since SVG markup tends to be a long string, I think a taller textarea control would be more suitable than the current single-line one
- Pasting incorrect markup doesn't give the user any indication that there's an error. The user is left with a multi-line string displayed in a 1-line textarea, and the cursor below the last line.

Would be awesome if we could use svgomg to convert an SVG to keep it's text editable.

Is that possible?

Thanks

body: Not really a bug, but did I miss something?

title: Cannot go back to Image tab in Firefox
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/ in Firefox
2. Select Paste Markup and paste a simple SVG document
3. Switch to the Code tab.
4. Click the Image tab.

Results: the tab itself gets focused but the Code content remains.

![svgomg-fx-tab-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/243601/17273137/7917b73c-56ab-11e6-8ecb-3345d065af1e.png)

Note: I have this issue systematically, _but_ when keeping the Firefox devtools open to look at what is happening, it ends up working most of the time. With the devtools closed, I’ve seen it working a few times, but not often. It’s kind of an intermittent bug.

Tested today on Firefox 48 and 49 on OSX, but I’ve had this issue on Win10 as well I think, and for a very long time (maybe since the first release of SVGOMG).

body:
This PR allows a background toggle to see intricacies in white or semi-transparent SVGs. I ran into this issue recently on a project.

- Adds background fill option to a hot pink background
- Resolves #40

title: Option request: remove fill and fill-rule
body: Sometimes you want to color the SVG with a CSS `fill`.

title: Group elements with the same fill color or stroke color and assign a class
body:
**Feature request:**

I hope it is possible to achieve it following these rules:

For each element with `fill="#000000"` assign a class `.k1` and remove inline color definition;
For each element with `fill="#FFFFFF"` assign a class `.k2`...

then add the class to the top of `<svg>` within a `<style>` element

A further improvement would be to detect all siblings sharing the same fill value and wrap them in a `<g>`. Example:

```
<path fill="#000">
<path fill="#000">
<path fill="#000">
```

becomes:

```
<style>
  .k1 { fill: #000 }
</style>

<g class="k1">
  <path>
  <path>
  <path>
</g>
```

title: Indicate differences visually
body:
Hello,

Let me once again thank you for the great tool!

I’m not sure it’s possible, but here goes: with all my SVG optimisations, I just try to go as far as I can without introducing too many distortions in the image. To judge how the optimised image differs from the original quickly toggling them both works well. Unfortunately, this is now not possible as with every click on Show original I have to wait for the calculations to finish (I would rather have it show the cached view at the current zoom/pan).

Here are two other possible ways to indicate differences (original 5,5MB https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e3/Caucasus_mountain_range_map-fr.svg, optimised 1,6MB):
- a quick toggling:
  ![caucasus_mountain_range_map-fr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6032869/14155810/44db1c16-f6bb-11e5-90c5-640aa3665f12.gif)
- a blend mode of difference applied to the top optimised image overlayed over the original:
  ![caucasus_mountain_range_map-fr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6032869/14155825/5812e70a-f6bb-11e5-9979-6a1cf7366942.jpg)

The second option would be more indicative with increased contrast or equalize filter, but that’s even less available in CSS than blend modes, I suppose.

In an ideal world SVG(OMG) would accept a user-provided tolerance and asses the output of similar operations to optimise images until it reaches a given distortion.

Just thinking out loud, feel free to close whenever.

Regards
m.

title: Support namespace-less SVGs
body:
The namespace in SVGs is optional for inline elements, but if I try to paste one such SVG into SVGOMG, it fails to load them because they are in a iframe where the namespace is actually required:

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/115237/13352451/9cec4864-dc8d-11e5-802f-3f7435fee53f.png)

It would be great if you could add a missing namespace to these SVGs for preview purpose, and ideally also remove it again before downloading.

title: Illustrator CC 2015 export SVG and Load failed: Invalid character entity
body:
Hi,

Maybe this is a set error/RTFM thing but maybe not.  I exported a logo from Illustrator CC 2015 and received the initial 'Load failed: Invalid character entity'.  I then looked a your demo's code and saw there was no DOCTYPE element so took that out of my file.

I also ripped out the pile of info Illustrator adds to the file is now 9KB instead of a massive 791KB.  So glad I've learned that trick.  This includes the AI's XML namespace declaration.

Am I doing something wrong or is it an issue with svgo?  

I've attached the file so you can investigate if you need to.

And thanks for providing svgo and so many ways to use it.  I've had to rename it as text since GitHub doesn't allow attaching SVGs or XML (find that one a bit odd)

Regards,
Lee.

[Logo copy.txt](https://github.com/jakearchibald/svgomg/files/33011/Logo.copy.txt)

title: ARIA attributes are removed as "unknown"
body:
Currently SVGOMG removes ARIA attributes such as "aria-labelledby" if the "Remove unknowns and defaults" option is enabled.

A pattern that I use is to label the contents of an SVG image with its title element:

```
<svg aria-labelledby="image-title">
<title id="image-title">Title Of This Image</title>
....
</svg>
```

Reference: https://www.paciellogroup.com/blog/2013/12/using-aria-enhance-svg-accessibility/

Would it be possible to add attributes beginning with "aria-" into the "known" category?

(there may be some knock-on effects for the "Clean IDs" option: if an ID is being referenced by an ARIA attribute, it shouldn't be removed)

title: Allow decimal precision to go to 0
body: I've gone so far as to make a bookmarklet to hack this in, since every once in a while you get some SVGs that really benefit from dropping the decimal points.

title: Fix npm 3 support
body:
npm 3 has flat dependencies, so the regeneratore/runtime dependency
can't be deeply nested anymore.

title: Don't minify error messages
body:
Whenever SVGOMG chokes on an SVG, it presents the user with something like `Error: s[element] is not defined.`

Going up the chain from svgomg > svgo > sax, it looks like those errors are human-readable at some point, and include information like "namespace not bound," "element not recognized according to DTD," etc.

It would be less hair-raising if those error messages could persist, somehow.

title: Add option 'Remove hidden layer elements'
body:
I noticed when exporting from Illustrator `.st1{display:none;}`.

If there's hidden layers it outputs the code in the SVG and then hides them. I understand that sometimes this might be useful, but it would be nice to have an option to remove them if possible.

E.g.
Toggling the option on would remove any code classes with `display: none` along with associated tag.

Hopefully that makes sense. I'm interested to know what you think, or if there's another solution to this issue that I've missed.

title: Save parameter settings and features
body: I just discovered svgomg and it's clearly best in breed - nice job. I'm going to run 50 or 60 similar svg files through it. I can't help but think that it would be nice if I could save my settings and features, so that I don't have to edit the list every time. Even if this were a session-based "save settings" feature, it would be a huge benefit, but a user sign-up/in might permit the user to create and save multiple settings profiles, which would be handy for different illustration types and desired svg output.

title: Minifying error: Maximum call stack size exceeded
body: How can I reduce the stack size in order to upload my svg file?  Are there any workarounds?

title: Dealing with a very large SVG file (244 Mo)
body:
I have a 244 Mo SVG file produced by the Matlab function "plot2svg". Usually the function produces files of a reasonable size, but I gather this time the plot was relatively complex in terms of number of points. I can't open the SVG file in Inkscape (0.48.4) so I've been trying to optimize the SVG file to reduce file size. I tried the SVGOMG GUI (https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/) on Firefox (40.0.2) and Chrome (44.0.2403.157 m) but when loading the image it would hang or crash, respectively. 

Is the online version of SVGOMG simply not built to deal with large SVG files? What can I do?

Edit: turns out it was a stupid coding mistake that caused the same line to get plotted over and over, hence the huge file size. my bad..

title: Feature: Convert SVG via URL parameter
body: It would be awesome if SVGO could optimize SVG markup provided by a URL parameter ( `https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/?svg=%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%22%20viewBox%3D%220%200%2050%2050%22%3E ...` ). This would allow quick optimization from another webapp or even from a desktop app like [Alfred](http://www.alfredapp.com/).

title: Provide information for users who visit the site on an unsupported browser
body:
See: https://twitter.com/jaffathecake/status/616548434422702080

Information can include:
- Minimum browser requirements
- Suggested alternatives beyond the browser (even if it’s just a link to SVGO, or a tutorial about integrating SVGO into your workflow)

title: Unable to access information about this tool and SVGO if JS fails
body: If JavaScript fails to load, the links in the menu don’t work. Some of these depend on the presence of JavaScript, so perhaps should have a disabled state in this case? But two are useful and have no dependancy; the link to the README file, and the link to SVGO. These should work regardless.

title: Trim viewbox
body:
I needed this solution just now and wondered if it would be a nice feature?

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23560038/html5-inline-svg-autocrop-whitespace

Works pretty well, although there might still be some adjustments needed to the to the height and width if they are already set.

title: Easily Copy Out of Code View
body:
I love using the Paste Markup & Code View to quickly optimize SVGs without having to mess with a lot of files. However, when I toggle over to Code View, I want to hit CMD + A to select all and copy the code out, but I always end up text from the UI:

```
Open SVG
Paste markup
Demo
Contribute
About
Powered by the incredible SVGO


IMAGE
CODE
765 bytes - 12.97% saving
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 100 100"> ... </svg>
```

Any way to make it easier to copy the code view? Two suggestions:
- Make Code View a textarea or iframe so it's isolated from the rest of the document
- Add `user-select: none` to all the UI elements to prevent the text from being selected.

title: Is this project a browserfied version of SVGO?
body:
Hi, 

I'm curious as to what this build actually is and how it was put together. I did a `browserify svgo.js -o svg.js` and the output looks nothing like what you have running at https://jakearchibald.github.io/svgomg/js/page.js

Out of curiosity, what exactly was used to make this project?

Many thanks.

title: "Remove viewBox" doesn't
body:
Before:

![screenshot 2015-02-12 12 19 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8072522/6172931/0e1c1c5a-b2b2-11e4-978c-61cc0ef918d1.png)

After:

![screenshot 2015-02-12 12 20 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8072522/6172932/0e1d04da-b2b2-11e4-8308-d6fa679a1d49.png)

This isn't a big problem, since all things considered one almost always wants a `viewBox`. What's interesting, though, is that it seems to trigger another go-round on the multipass compressor, which shaved off another 3% (at the expense of visual quality).

title: Resizing/panning is super slow in Firefox
body:
…maybe IE too, I haven't tried outside a VM.

It's fast in Safari/Chrome because it's rendered to a texture (which causes #9), maybe do this manually?

When touch/click on the image, hide the SVG and replace with a canvas with the SVG written to it. This will be a lot quicker in the browsers that are repainting the SVG per position/scale change. Once panning/scaling complete, swap the SVG back.

This could look weird with animated SVGs, as the canvas would represent a single static state.

title: Work around pixelation in Safari/Chrome
body:

I tried switching to a non-3d transform after 300ms of idle, but it really kills performance, even on desktop (Canary is ok, but stable Chrome dies).

Need to find a workaround.

title: Fix undefined reference to PathRemoveFileSpec()
body:
On Windows, compiling with MinGW produces undefined reference to `::PathRemoveFileSpecW()` due to not being linked to `shlwapi`. This patch fixes that.

```cpp
> mingw32-make -f Makefile -j4
E:/msys64/mingw64/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-w64-mingw32/10.2.0/../../../../x86_64-w64-mingw32/bin/ld.exe: C:\Users\Florastamine\AppData\Local\Temp\leanify.exe.8FLneM.ltrans9.ltrans.o:<artificial>:(.text+0xdb3): undefined reference to `__imp_PathRemoveFileSpecW'
collect2.exe: error: ld returned 1 exit status
mingw32-make: *** [Makefile:43: leanify] Error 1
```

Tested on `gcc (Rev9, Built by MSYS2 project) 10.2.0`, but I've seen this issue from as early as 7.1.

title: APNG corruption
body:
Hi.

As APNG is explicitly supported here, I tried `leanify -v` on some of my files.
It appears to work and does not report anything suspicious:
```
Processing: 4_frames_good_from_gif2apng.png
PNG detected.
tEXt chunk removed, 36 bytes.
Filter strategy zero: 2409 bytes
4.57 KB -> 4.37 KB      Leanified: 203 B (4.34%)
```
```
Processing: 4_frames_bad_edges_left.png
PNG detected.
Filter strategy zero: 2407 bytes
24.08 KB -> 20.15 KB    Leanified: 3.93 KB (16.31%)
```
```
Processing: 4_frames_bad_edges_right.png
PNG detected.
Filter strategy zero: 2409 bytes
24.12 KB -> 20.17 KB    Leanified: 3.95 KB (16.37%)
```
But result either shows areas of garbled pixels after the first frame, or is completely not animated, depending on specific file.
XnView says that unplayable file is "multipage" instead of simply playing animation, and selecting its pages does not show any change.

Identical results with Leanify build 244, 243, and the last v0.4.3 release from the GitHub page.
Edit: Also identical results with build from latest source on a Linux server.

All files from gif2apng v1.9 (this was the best result I got back then, when I tried various ways to create APNG) become garbled.
Other files are probably from paint.net with plugins. They become unplayable.

I'm attaching the original and result files here.
[apng_corruption.zip](https://github.com/JayXon/Leanify/files/5602744/apng_corruption.zip)

I'm thinking to try creating APNG files with more recent software sometime later.

title: ZopfliPNG error: Decompress Zlib data failed.
body:
Hi.

While trying to optimize one ORA file saved years ago in MyPaint (which overall went very well, 7 MB cut down to 4), I got an error message about one PNG inside:
```
-> data/layer200.png
ZopfliPNG failed!
Decompress Zlib data failed.
```
Running Leanify directly on this extracted PNG gives the same message and the file is unchanged, only modtime.
I tried all 4 versions of the last build (243) from https://ci.appveyor.com/project/JayXon/leanify - same error message.

OptiPNG, OxiPNG, TruePNG all have no problem optimizing it.
Running Leanify directly after them also has no problems and saves some more bytes (same result as OxiPNG -Z alone, but faster).

I'm attaching the unoptimized PNG file here.
![layer200.png](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4068475/99190769-87ee4e80-2779-11eb-9c11-4d71390f7f8b.png)

title: May mention OpenRaster file type as supported
body:
Hello,
OpenRaster file type is not mentioned, while OpenDocument is.

I tried Leanify with some ORA files and it seems to work without problems, if only taking quite some time compressing PNGs inside.
Keeps `mimetype` as stored, minifies XML and PNGs, does nothing to app-specific `*.dat`, as expected.
Shaves about 30-50% on some files saved in MyPaint and Drawpile.

I'd suggest to put it separately from OpenDocument.
Applications that understand them are mutually exclusive, if I'm not mistaken.

Maybe like this:
```
#### OpenDocument (.odt, .ods, .odp, .odb, .odg, .odf)

It is based on XML and ZIP.

#### OpenRaster (.ora)

It is based on OpenDocument and PNG.
```

title: Problems found with your Leanify X86 code (possible malware)
body:
Very quickly:

I've been using Nikkhokkho's Fileoptimizer software for over a year, but I can't use his latest release because both my AV and VirusTotal found malware in it. Some of the files marked as infected were Leanify which he included in his program.

I brought this up with him on Sourceforge and he pretty much brushed me off.

> Thank you for your offer. Usually it is better to report the FP to AV vendors. Unfortunately according to my experience, Avast team is not very responsive. Reason is that Leanify is also opensource, which means that it is hard of being harmful

So I thought I'd download Leanify, both x86 and x64, stable and nightly builds from your page so I could test them for myself. My AV pronounced them clean. Virustotal's scanners reported some malware in the x86 builds. The 64-bit builds were clean. I uploaded screenshots of my findings on Virustotal.

Before I went back to Nikkhokkho on Sourceforge I thought I'd let you know about this. I think you and Nikkhokkho make very useful software and I want to keep using it.

Thanks,
Tony
 
![leanify_win32_malware](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63214762/78514214-de23f980-7775-11ea-9243-07c978146d1a.png)
![leanify_win32_nightly_malware](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63214762/78514208-d6645500-7775-11ea-8111-a96f2a2aa4c0.png)

title: Fuzzing: Specially crafted input file results in repeatable crash when compiled with ASAN under Ubuntu/GCC. Allows for limited, controlled OOB read.
body:
I found Leanify while doing some research and decided to use Radamsa to test the robustness of the application. It appears pretty solid. I grabbed a ton of test files and then ran this simple loop to generate some more files; for i in $(ls); do cat $i | radamsa; done.

I did note a few things that were interesting, the most of which was a crash noted by ASAN from mutated files that proved hard to debug. I've done the test case reduction already down from several hundred bytes to the smallest byte string I could find that still induced the crash.

I did note that by modifying the length of the input file, the resulting address of the crash could be changed. Note that in the reproduction steps below, amongst the output shows the READ attempt at crash time. Another interesting crash I noted was a WRITE of 1024 bytes in another crash file.
//Cleaning up stack traces.

title: EOCD not found!
body:
It has been reported on FileOptimizer forums, that Leanify is corrupting APK files in some cases.

I have been able to reproduce it with daily binaries on both x86, and x64. Problem seems to be Leanify aborts with message "EOCD not found!" but does not generate an error errorlevel (it exits with code 0).

You have more details as well as sample files here: https://sourceforge.net/p/nikkhokkho/discussion/fileoptimizer/thread/74f4f5df/

Anyway, let me know if further details are needed.

title: ZIP: switch to store if deflate makes file larger
ODT corruption
body:
As reported on FileOptimizer discussion (http://sourceforge.net/p/nikkhokkho/discussion/fileoptimizer/thread/666f945a/#2f64)

Setup: Win7x86 with FileOptimizer v7.60.1252

Steps:

Optimize a large LibreOffice ODT (Open Text Document) file (tested on 898k and 130k files)

Open file 
Defect: 
http://i.imgur.com/wqV9QHP.png 

OpenOffice 4.1.1 had the same response. LibreOffice (v4.3.5.2 and v4.3.7.2) prompted me to repair it and it came back ok.

Tested both with 32 and 64-bit versions and operating systems.

File compression was excellent: 898k -> 751k (or 84%). This is remarkable because it's even better than a 7-zip "ultra"-level compression of the same file, which cut less than 1% off the file size.

title: CreateProcess never ends
body:
A issue reported on FileOptimizer have come after some investigation on my side to be releated to Leanify 0.4.2 x86 and x64 precompiled binaries.
The problem happens on at least GZ and PNG files.

Launching it from pure command-line (cmd.exe) works OK, and properly returns errorlevel, but when launched using CreateProcess, GetExitCodeProcess code always returns 259 (STILL_ACTIVE), and what is more, asking it for completion with WaitForSingleObject INFINITE it gets stuck waiting.

Details are here: https://sourceforge.net/p/nikkhokkho/discussion/general/thread/d04bc925/

title: some spaces in docx is removed
body:
The reason is `TinyXML2` does not support `xml:space="preserve"`.

```
<w:t xml:space="preserve"> </w:t>
```

will become

```
<w:t xml:space="preserve"/>
```

But the author of `TinyXML2` is not willing to fix it.
Should I switch to another xml library?

title: Include Alt Text for images from Twitter
body:
## Steps to reproduce the issue

I have made a [small test case on Codepen](https://codepen.io/adamjohnson/pen/VwawLxJ) that outlines the issue. Right click and inspect any image in the timeline.

## Results

Right now, the [alternative text](https://axesslab.com/alt-texts/) for images from Twitter is [hardcoded](https://github.com/jasonmayes/Twitter-Post-Fetcher/blob/master/js/twitterFetcher.js#L428) as `Image from Tweet`.

## Desired results

Does the Twitter API include alt text for images? Twitter allows users to customize alt text now. It would be a [huge accessibility win](https://accessibility.18f.gov/checklist/) if images on Twitter with alt text could be pulled with their customized alt text by Twitter Post Fetcher.

title: Support multiple images
body:
The regex in extractImageUrl was only handling one image per post (only the first image, even if an image grid is included).

This fix sets the matching on multiple images, and extracts each URLs, while keeping the backward compatibility for the "dataonly" mode that is expecting only one image in the 'image' variable.

It should probably be refined to mark when more than one image is loaded, and to prevent multiple call to extractImagesUrl if not necessary.

title: Consider adding aria-labelledby to .timePosted for accessibility
body:
![Example of where to use aria-labelledby on Tweet time](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/575865/37054644-66e2b54e-214d-11e8-9b39-8744ba9b4766.png)

## Steps to reproduce the issue

  1. Use Twitter Post Fetcher and output tweets with `.timePosted` visible.
  1. Make sure multiple tweets from the same day are visible (like in the image above).

## Results

Twitter Post Fetcher will output links like "Posted on March 1, 2018" for each tweet posted on March 1st.

## Request

WCAG 2.0 suggests links with the same link text to use either `aria-labelledby` or `aria-label`. Would you consider adding `aria-labelledby` to `.timePosted`? The `aria-labelledby` can point to `.tweet`.

Here's [the spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20/#navigation-mechanisms-refs). The [Siteimprove Chrome Extension](chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/siteimprove-accessibility/efcfolpjihicnikpmhnmphjhhpiclljc) is a great tool to help test accessibility issues like this. [MDN Docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/ARIA_Techniques/Using_the_aria-labelledby_attribute) for `aria-labelledby`.

title: Username failure fix
body:
An additional check for the definition of `data` is necessary, due to `data` being able to be returned as `undefined`.

In the fast-return due to an error, we also need to reset the `inProgress` state to `false` otherwise we cannot fetch another tweet and instead will infinitely queue fetches. Similarly, we need to check the queue for any remaining fetch requests, and call `fetch` as appropriate.

title: Documentation references likes instead of lists
body:
In your documentation within exampleUsage.js for `@param object.list`, it looks like you forgot to update a part after copying/pasting:

```
 * @param object.list {Object} An object containing a refernece to the
 *     screen name we wish to grab likes for. Should be like this:
 *     {"listSlug": 'inspiration', "screenName": 'jason_mayes'}
```

(see https://github.com/jasonmayes/Twitter-Post-Fetcher/blob/master/js/exampleUsage.js#L30)

I believe "... grab likes for ..." should be "... grab list for ..." in this context.  It should be obvious, but it might be confusing for some.

Also, "reference" is misspelled for profile, likes, and list documentation.

Thanks for tackling this problem.  This saved me a bunch of time setting up OAuth and back-end authentication for a simple front-end task.

title: Can't create "user timeline" widget
body:
I want to show on my website my the two lastest tweets

These are steps:
- Go to www.twitter.com and sign in as normal, go to your settings page.
- Go to "Widgets" on the left hand side.
  **\- Create a new widget for what you need eg "user time line" or "search" etc.**
- Now go back to settings page, and then go back to widgets page and you should see the widget you just created. Click edit.
- Look at the URL in your web browser, you will see a long number like this: “727179718227836928”
- Use this as your ID below instead!

As you can see in the image attached. **I don't have the option to create a "user timeline widget".  I can only create one for search.**

![twitterfetcherissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16642768/17040736/92d0aa1e-4f6f-11e6-9212-14971a34eabb.png)

title: prevent image requests and downloads, empty tweets, and undefined image source
body: https://github.com/jasonmayes/Twitter-Post-Fetcher/issues/95

title: ideas to prevent: image requests and downloads, empty tweets, and undefined image source
body:
@jasonmayes 

First, thank you again for a very useful program. 

I wanted to run a few code ideas by you and others.
These ideas address:
- when showImages is false and printUser is false, image requests and downloads are made (I looked through closed issues to read your ideas and suggestions on the topic)
- when showImages is false, empty tweets without text are displayed
- new media card types display as having undefined image source
  https://github.com/jasonmayes/Twitter-Post-Fetcher/issues/74

Here is a gist with the code changes. Changes made to the original file are wrapped in the comments "CHANGES" and "END CHANGES".
https://gist.github.com/MrKarlDilkington/1d4c1d3bb54638b91b6ac1da230f3c1e

With the changes, if you don't show tweet images or user images, only 1 small request/download is made for the Twitter JSON. The request and download savings is substantial.

title: domId will not work is there is a dash in the name
body:
Hello, the twitter widget does not output if there is a `-` (dash) in the `domId`. It does not give any console errors, just nothing is outputted.

For example the following will not work:

```
var configLikes = {
  "profile": {"screenName": 'jason_mayes'},
  "domId": 'example-likes',
  "maxTweets": 3,
  "enableLinks": true,
  "showUser": true,
  "showTime": true,
  "showImages": true,
  "lang": 'en'
};
twitterFetcher.fetch(configLikes);
```

title: Insecure Reponse Error
body:
Hey Jason, 

Your Twitter Fetcher is awesome and I've been using it without problems for the  last couple of weeks, but today, when I tried to load it I got this error message from the Console:

twitterFetcher.js:163 GET https://cdn.syndication.twimg.com/widgets/timelines/708033764807483393?&lan…witterFetcher.callback&suppress_response_codes=true&rnd=0.5455620516036825 net::ERR_INSECURE_RESPONSE

I did some researching on my own and some people are saying it's a protective feature from Chrome, which considers this resource insecure and blocks it, but like I said, I've been using your API for the last few weeks without a hitch, so I'm a bit confused as to why the browser suddenly started throwing errors today. What are your thoughts? Do you think it's a problem on my end or no?

title: media images have an undefined source

@jasonmayes First off, I want to thank you for creating and maintaining Twitter-Post-Fetcher. It is a great tool and I really appreciate it. With the recent Twitter changes, I was curious to know if anyone has encountered img elements being displayed with undefined src, with `"showImages": true`? I looked through existing issues and did not see any references to it. **Example 1** HTML ```
``` Displayed HTML ![preview1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10898145/13545885/cde6708a-e268-11e5-9c23-3e167b317b19.png) Original Tweet ![tweet1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10898145/13545886/d48ee03e-e268-11e5-894b-f4afc89604c3.png) images[n] ```

Looks like interacting in Virtual Reality is a lot better than a few years…

Looks like interacting in Virtual Reality is a lot better than a few years back. But maybe it is a little too good! Check out the dangers too in the video… - Jason Mayes - Google+

plus.google.com
``` **Example 2** HTML ```
``` Displayed HTML ![preview2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10898145/13545887/db220066-e268-11e5-8c08-bd300d802b64.png) Original Tweet ![tweet2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10898145/13545899/381de69a-e269-11e5-908b-cc13240cf32d.jpg) images[n] ```
``` Although a bit crude, adding a check to see if the result of extractImageUrl() is not undefined appears to work. ``` if (showImages && images[n] !== undefined && extractImageUrl(images[n]) !== undefined) { op += '
' + '' + '
'; } ``` Also, are you open to a pull request that adds a config option for choosing between data-src-1x and data-src-2x?

title: Tweet time is undefined in Firefox as there's no .textContent fallback to .innerHtml

Hello!

Just noticed a little buggette - the time attribute when requesting dataOnly is undefined in firefox as it doesn't support innerText - looks like you have a test for innerText support and fall-back to .textContent elsewhere in the code but missed it on line 254 (latest v15 build), i've patched my local copy from:

`time: times[n].innerText,`

to: 

`time: times[n].innerText ? times[n].innerText : times[n].textContent,`

Kind Regards,
Rick.

title: Switched protocol-relative Twitter link to HTTPS
body: Specifically defining the protocol fixes issues when using this library in a local file.  With HTTPS available everywhere on Twitter there is now little benefit to using HTTP.  In fact, [Twitter's documentation](https://dev.twitter.com/web/embedded-timelines) all uses HTTPS links.  Paul Irish has even [called protocol-relative URLs an anti-pattern](https://twitter.com/paul_irish/status/588502455530311680) when HTTPS is available.  It is probably just best practice to force HTTPS.

I'm happy to revise and/or submit this a PR if this is something you are interested in incorporating.

title: Sorry, bug in a browser, not TwitterFetcher's
Preserve timezone in formatter function
body:
Internally, twitterFetcher.js strips the timezone from Twitter to more easily support native, cross-browser date parsing. However, this causes relative date formatting to breakdown as tweets that were published at 6PM UTC appear as if they will be published in the future when displayed at 4PM PDT.

I have added the actual datetime attribute value to the dateFormatter function arguments to support using an external library (moment.js in my case) for parsing the date and maintaining the timezone.

Please note - I did not re-minify as I'm not sure what tool you are using for that.

title: Plugin cannot be used in non-Android application projects
body:
Using the plugin in a vanilla Gradle Java/Kotlin application (as generated by `gradle init`) like this:

```gradle
plugins {
    id 'application'
    id 'com.jaredsburrows.license' version '0.8.90'
}
```

results in the following error:

```
> Could not resolve all artifacts for configuration ':classpath'.
   > Could not find com.android.tools.build:gradle:3.6.0.
     Searched in the following locations:
       - https://plugins.gradle.org/m2/com/android/tools/build/gradle/3.6.0/gradle-3.6.0.pom
     If the artifact you are trying to retrieve can be found in the repository but without metadata in 'Maven POM' format, you need to adjust the 'metadataSources { ... }' of the repository declaration.
     Required by:
         project : > com.jaredsburrows.license:com.jaredsburrows.license.gradle.plugin:0.8.90 > com.jaredsburrows:gradle-license-plugin:0.8.90
```

This seems to be a regression, since plugin version `0.8.42` works fine.

title: Don't (re)generate license report if not needed
body:
Gradle tasks have built-in support to detect changes in the input and output properties. Suppressing it via https://github.com/jaredsburrows/gradle-license-plugin/blob/e51039c38a773f9fd369d60ae12578e176cd93ff/src/main/kotlin/com/jaredsburrows/license/LicenseReportTask.kt#L57 is bad practice which among other things might significantly increase project build time. If the license task always reruns, a new report is generated and a new Android APK needs to be packaged as the asset file changes which impacts the build time with no/only code changes.

Build Analyzer (available in Android Studio) marks this task with a warning:
```
At 14:20, Jan 15, 2021, Android Studio detected the following issue(s) with Gradle plugin com.jaredsburrows.license

Always-Run Tasks
This task might be setting its up-to-date check to always return false.

Plugin: com.jaredsburrows.license
Task: licenseDebugReport
Task type: com.jaredsburrows.license.LicenseReportTask
Issues for the same task were detected in 1 module(s), total execution time was 0.1s (3.8%), by module:
  Execution mode: FULL, time: 0.1s (3.8%), determines build duration: true, on critical path: false, issues: Always-Run Tasks

====Build information:====
Execution date: 2021-01-15 14:20
Total build duration: 3.9s
Configuration time: 0.3s (8.1%)
```

title: [Feature Request] methods to fix unknown licenses
body:
Hello. Prompting the user to be aware of the unknown licenses is really a great feature. But we cannot just ship the notice without doing anything. Currently there seems no easy way to correct the information.

1. For very old libraries without license information in the pom, it would be better to give the user a chance to correct the license and then easily go ahead with the process. I would like to have a local file to override the license information for certain packages so that we can still automate the process.

2. Licenses of many pacakges are unknown just because they are proprietary packages pulled from internal repos. So it would be great to a mechanism to exclude packages from certain servers, or with certain prefixes. For example, a variable that users can set the server names or prefixes to.

Thank you.

title: Running license{$variant}Report while process{$variant}Manifest results in EMPTY json/html
body:
While using your gradle license plugin in a bigger project I noticed that it's not possible to run the **license{$variant}Report** in a task that also depends on **process{$variant}Manifest**, from the Android Gradle Plugin, somehow. Please see the following code. I also **created a simple project** [here](https://github.com/jomapp/GradleLicensePluginIssueSimple). 

Running **generateLicenses** works fine, but running **createEmptyLicenseReportIssue** instead, resolves in an empty json/html file.

Thank you for looking into this issue!

```
licenseReport {
    generateHtmlReport = false
    generateJsonReport = true
    copyHtmlReportToAssets = false
    copyJsonReportToAssets = false
}

task generateLicenses { // Does Work ✅
    dependsOn 'licenseDebugReport'
}

task createEmptyLicenseReportIssue { // Does not work ⛔️
    dependsOn 'processDebugManifest'
    dependsOn 'generateLicenses'
}

generateLicenses.mustRunAfter('processDebugManifest')
```

title: Include Copyright owner/date in HTML license report; show multiple licenses
body:
This change addresses issue #109 (nee #50) about including Copyright text in the report.
It also handles the rare (but real -- see "Checker Qual") case where there are multiple license kinds by including all the licenses. Some minor changes to improve readability of both the raw html and the final result.

The raw information in the POM is often incomplete in this regard, so it makes a "best guess" when that happens. Those are easily discovered and edited in the raw html if needed.

Incidentally, it also adds another spelling of the MIT license URL (with a .php suffix). I didn't check whether the other "standard" licenses have that form.

title: Crash, Windows only - file separator isn't a resource separator.

2)  The function should check for null result from getResource (although this isn't actually likely).
(getResource is Java, not Kotlin, thus it's not String? ).

title: Versions are not picked up from parent poms
body:
Some projects like `okHttp` seems to not codify versions directly, but in the parent pom files that have a 1:1 mapping with each release.
I can't tell if this is in accordance to the pom spec. But the maven plugin for gradle itself seems to honor this codification.

```xml
<parent>
    <groupId>com.squareup.okhttp3</groupId>
    <artifactId>parent</artifactId>
    <version>3.12.1</version>
  </parent>
```

The problem I see if that the license plugin has versions set to null, which is frankly quite reasonable.
```json
{
        "project": "OkHttp",
        "description": null,
        "version": null
}
```

Could we have this pickup the version from the parent pom instead ?

title: More dependency details
body:
Hi. Thanks for the plugin, it's been quite useful.

I got this strange requirement of reporting a very detailed licensing information each dependency including the transitive ones. That adds up to about ~180 dependencies, which means it's better be automated.

I managed to compile something using your library and a python script using the output json but there is still a lot to do. I noticed there are quite a lot more useful fields in pom files. I thought I could just get them but maven inheritance seems a little complex to deal with and you seem to have already implemented the traversing logic.

On a quick look these could be useful though some of them are maybe too much detail. Just gonna give examples from jersey project's POM instead of explaining

- name: `<name>jersey</name>` Children of the project will have more specific names of course.
- url: `<url>https://jersey.java.net/</url>`
- organization: `<organization><name>Oracle Corporation</name><url>http://www.oracle.com/</url></organization>`
- mailingLists: `<mailingLists><mailingList><name>Announcements</name><archive>http://java.net/projects/jersey/lists/announce/archive</archive><post>announce@jersey.java.net</post></mailingList>.....`
- scm: `<scm><connection>scm:git:git://java.net/jersey~code</connection><developerConnection>scm:git:ssh://git.java.net/jersey~code</developerConnection><url>http://java.net/projects/jersey/sources/code/show</url><tag>2.25.1</tag></scm>`
- issueManagement: `<issueManagement><system>JIRA</system><url>http://java.net/jira/browse/JERSEY/</url></issueManagement>`
- ciManagement: `<ciManagement><system>Hudson</system><url>http://hudson.glassfish.org/job/Jersey-trunk-multiplatform/</url></ciManagement>`
- developers: `<developers><developer><name>Pavel Bucek</name><organization>Oracle Corporation</organization><organizationUrl>http://www.oracle.com/</organizationUrl><url>https://blogs.oracle.com/PavelBucek</url></developer>.....`

Also specific to my use case but maybe.. A list of dependencies that depends on this dependency. Could be built while traversing. It is already provided by `dependencies` task of gradle but not really in a scripting friendly way.

I could try to take a shot at this and make a PR but my 0 experience with Groovy made it quite difficult to read the code when I was trying to figure out where you were getting the licensing information. So the result might be a little ugly :).

title: Running multiple build variant license tasks crashes build
body:
In a project with a few different build variants, running a full `gradle build` results in a crash.

The crash seems to be caused by each variant's license task conflicting with one another. When the first license task runs, [it creates a configuration called 'poms'](https://github.com/jaredsburrows/gradle-license-plugin/blob/master/src/main/groovy/com/jaredsburrows/license/LicenseReportTask.groovy#L67). Then when the second variant's license task runs, it attempts to create the same configuration, which crashes since it already exists.

Here's a small example app that demos this issue: https://github.com/egargan/license-plugin-issue-demo.

The error output can be viewed in the  [/gradle-build-error-output](https://github.com/egargan/license-plugin-issue-demo/blob/master/gradle-build-error-output) file. The [/app/build.gradle](https://github.com/egargan/license-plugin-issue-demo/blob/master/app/build.gradle) file sets up the calls to each task.

title: Fix for #52 - Eliminate Duplicate Licenses
body:
This is is a proposed fix for issue #52 

I changed the HtmlReport class a bit to lookup licenses in the license map by url and name, and group them all together in the report.

Also:
-adds <a name /> elements for all licenses (including "no license) - not just the ones in the license map
-updates tests to reflect my changes
-adds more names/urls for the Apache 2.0 license
-adds the CC0 1.0 Universal license to the map

title: make any links to licenses clickable in preformatted text
body: This simply surrounds any links to license text with `` so that the user can click on them to follow the link and read the license.

title: Identical license shows up twice
body:
I just generated a report and noticed that the Apache License 2.0 shows up in there twice. The first time for:
- Apache Log4j API
- Apache Log4j Commons Logging Bridge
- Apache Log4j Core
and the second time for:
- Apache Commons Logging
- Elsa Serialization
- Gson
- Guava: Google Core Libraries for Java
- Kotlin-runtime
- Kotlin-stdlib
- LZ4 and xxHash
- Mapdb
- Picocli - a mighty tiny Command Line Interface

The license text section in both is identical. So I had a look at the json, Mapdb here:

    {
        "project": "Mapdb",
        "description": "MapDB provides concurrent Maps, Sets and Queues backed by disk storage or off-heap memory. It is a fast, scalable and easy to use embedded Java database.",
        "version": "3.0.5",
        "developers": [
            "Jan Kotek"
        ],
        "url": "http://www.mapdb.org",
        "year": null,
        "licenses": [
            {
                "license": "The Apache Software License, Version 2.0",
                "license_url": "http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt"
            }
        ]
    },

And now log4j:

    {
        "project": "Apache Log4j API",
        "description": "The Apache Log4j API",
        "version": null,
        "developers": [
            
        ],
        "url": null,
        "year": null,
        "licenses": [
            {
                "license": "Apache License, Version 2.0",
                "license_url": "https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt"
            }
        ]
    },

Both license URLs are exactly the same, except for the http**s**.

title: Extra report info
body:
I needed to add some extra info into the JSON report for my own purposes. If you feel this is useful for others too, then please consider merging.

There are two related changes here:

1. Add dependencies for which no licenses were found into the reports, with an empty licenses array in the JSON report. The HTML report adds dependencies with no licenses in a "no licenses found" section.

2. Add the original gradle dependency string (group:name:version string) into the JSON report - makes it easier to track down a dependency if the description is not enough.

title: Dependencies without poms are ignored
body:
If a dependency exists but doesn't have a pom associated with it, this plugin will not include the dependency in either the HTML or JSON reports, or in the console logging.

We get logging when a dependency doesn't have any license info listed in the pom, but nothing is logged when the pom itself is not found.

I tried the gradle-license-plugin for a pure Kotlin project. However, I get the following error message:

```
An exception occurred applying plugin request [id: 'com.jaredsburrows.license', version: '0.7.0']
> Failed to apply plugin [id 'com.jaredsburrows.license']
   > License report plugin can only be applied to android or java projects.
```

title: [Feature] - Show complete license text
body: It is possible (and does it make sense) to show the complete license-text instead of just the title and the link? Just like in the screenshot in the `README.md` here: My generated code looks like this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3737512/33995992-fdd7f6ac-e0df-11e7-968e-668028a9171b.png)

title: Recursively scan parent POMs for license
body:
Previously, only the direct parent POM was scanned for license information. In many cases, this is not sufficient.

This pull request changes this behavior so that all parent POMs are scanned recursively. In my case, this finds A LOT of licenses that weren't found before, like for various Apache-commons and Jetty libraries.

title: Show warnings for missing dependencies
body: Based on https://github.com/jaredsburrows/gradle-license-plugin/issues/15#issuecomment-320940346, show warnings for when the plugin "misses" or "skips" a dependency.

title: Doesn't work with gradle 4.0, android plugin 3.0.0
body:
`debugCompile` and `releaseCompile` can no longer be resolved directly. Here is the error message:

```
* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':app:licenseProductionDevSdkDebugReport'.
> Resolving configuration 'debugCompile' directly is not allowed
```

The stacktrace reveals that this is coming from `LicenseReportTask.groovy:68`.

I was not having this issue prior to updating to Gradle 4.0. Any ETA on when can we expect support for latest Gradle version?

Thanks,
Alex

title: Gradle instructions are wrong
body:
README says: 
```
repositories {
  jcenter()
}
  
compile "com.jaredsburrows:gradle-license-plugin:0.4.0"
```
But it should say:
``` 
dependencies {
  classpath "com.jaredsburrows:gradle-license-plugin:0.4.0"
}

apply plugin: 'com.jaredsburrows.license'
```

Or am I wrong? I can make a PR if you want.

title: Mock android sdk to speed up ci build
Valid License URLs when generating reports
body:
Example:
```
  <licenses>
    <license>
      <name>NA</name>
      <url>NA</url>
      <distribution>repo</distribution>
    </license>
  </licenses>
```

The plugin cannot valid names but at least I can try to validate actual URLs to prevent generating reports with "NA, NA".

title: List Libraries by License in HTML Report
body:
This allows the plugin to easily handle duplicates and projects with multiple licenses.

Apache
 - License A

BSD
 - License B

Eclipse
 - License A
